vectorData.altText: 2. Sound is perceived in the ___________ lobe, specifically in the ______________ _______________  gyri. (3 words total; separate answers with one space)
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right! Auditory stimuli are perceived in the temporal lobe, specifically the transverse temporal gyri, which comprise primary auditory cortex.
Identify the major gyri of the cerebral hemisphere.
Transverse temporal gyri: buried in the lateral fissure, on the superior surface of the superior temporal gyrus. You must GENTLY open the lateral fissure to see the transverse temporal gyri.

They extend from halfway along the upper part of the superior temporal gyrus into the depths of the lateral fissure, ending in the posterior insula. The transverse temporal gyri are primary auditory cortex, where auditory stimuli are perceived.
Postcentral gyrus: parallel and posterior to the central sulcus.  This is primary somatosensory cortex where sensation from the surface of the body is perceived.
Superolateral view of the right cerebral hemisphere. From Serial Dissections of the Human Brainby Carlton G. Smith, M.D., Ph.D.
